title: How to Automatically Fill Your Decorative Garden Fountain

steps.headline: Run a small, unobtrusive hose up the center of the fountain and into the water bowl.
steps.description: (Try a black 1/4 inch hose and drilled 1/4" holes to route the hose. The hose should terminate in the water bowl, below the level you wish to maintain.)

steps.headline: Ensure there are no kinks in the hose, and seal all penetrations with waterproof silicone caulk.
Mount a mechanical float valve (from hardware store) in a plastic bucket, and place the bucket on a stake.
steps.description: The bucket should be positioned such that the water level in the bucket is the same height from the ground as the desired water level in the fountain. Conceal the bucket behind a bush or tree.

steps.headline: Connect a garden hose to the mechanical float valve, on the outside of the bucket.
steps.description: Necessary fittings can be obtained from any hardware store.

steps.headline: Connect other end of garden hose to spigot.
Run the tube from the bottom of the fountain to the bottom of the bucket (fitting obtained from hardware store).
steps.description: Take care to conceal the tube under bushed, mulch, etc.

steps.headline: Never manually fill your fountain again.

text: Unplug and drain the fountain.  Run a small, unobtrusive hose up the center of the fountain and into the water bowl. (Try a black 1/4 inch hose and drilled 1/4" holes to route the hose. The hose should terminate in the water bowl, below the level you wish to maintain.) Ensure there are no kinks in the hose, and seal all penetrations with waterproof silicone caulk.  Mount a mechanical float valve (from hardware store) in a plastic bucket, and place the bucket on a stake. The bucket should be positioned such that the water level in the bucket is the same height from the ground as the desired water level in the fountain. Conceal the bucket behind a bush or tree. Connect a garden hose to the mechanical float valve, on the outside of the bucket. Necessary fittings can be obtained from any hardware store. Connect other end of garden hose to spigot.  Run the tube from the bottom of the fountain to the bottom of the bucket (fitting obtained from hardware store). Take care to conceal the tube under bushed, mulch, etc. Fill and re-energize the fountain.  Turn on spigot.  Check for leaks  Never manually fill your fountain again.
